summary: This is a resubmitted procedural memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated April of an unspecified year, outlining the official procedures for placing inmates on Psychological Observation status. It details the criteria, monitoring requirements, and staff responsibilities for observing inmates with deteriorating mental health who are not imminently suicidal.

events.title: Initial Submission of Psychological Observation Procedures
events.description: The original Procedural Memorandum for Psychological Observation was submitted to the Warden and Associate Warden of Programs.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
keyFacts: The document establishes formal procedures for Psychological Observation of inmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Psychological Observation is for inmates with deteriorating mental health, personality disorders, or drug issues who are not imminently suicidal but whose behavior is unpredictable.
Only a psychologist can place or remove an inmate from Psychological Observation status.
Observation is conducted in the suicide watch area or designated SHU cells, with continuous monitoring by an Inmate Companion or staff member.
The memorandum is a resubmission with revisions, requiring updated signatures, indicating ongoing procedural oversight.
